conclusion: The image shows a bulletin board with objects A through F labeled with red arrows.
Objects A, C, D, E, F appear to be pins or pushpins of different colors holding papers to the board.
Object B appears to be a piece of turquoise/blue fabric or paper pinned to the board.
The question asks about the effect of gravity when objects A and B move through the air and are placed at locations C, D, E, F.
If A (a pin) is moved to positions C, D, E, or F, it would replace those pins in holding the papers.
If B (the fabric/paper) is moved to positions C, D, E, or F, it would need to be secured by pins.
Pins (like A) would press down into the board and hold materials in place due to gravity.
The fabric/paper (B) would lie flat against the board and any underlying materials due to gravity.

When objects A and B move through the air and are placed at the locations of objects C, D, E, F, gravity will cause the pins to press downward and secure materials, while the fabric/paper will lie flat.
If B is placed at pin locations, it would need to be secured by pins to stay in place against the pull of gravity.
The contact between these objects is maintained by the downward force of gravity, which keeps the pins pressed into the board and the fabric/paper flat against the surface.
